title: 'I stand here to present India‚Äôs side and to show mirror to those who refuse to see it': PM Modi in LS
content: Rajya Sabha witnessed uproar as JP Nadda and Mallikarjun Kharge clashed during a debate on Operation Sindoor and the Pahalgam attack. Nadda's remark accusing Kharge of losing mental balance ignited protests, leading to demands for retraction. Despite initial resistance, Nadda apologized but urged for expunging Kharge's remarks against Prime Minister Modi.

title: 'First time in history ... ': Priyanka slams PM on Trump 'announcing' ceasefire
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra attacked Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the ceasefire announcement made by US President Donald Trump. She questioned the government's accountability and accused them of prioritizing politics over public interest. Gandhi Vadra referenced Operation Sindoor and the understanding reached between India and Pakistan to end the conflict.

title: IND vs ENG | Gautam Gambhir vs curator fight: A complete timeline
content: Tensions flared ahead of the final India-England Test as Indian head coach Gautam Gambhir engaged in a heated exchange with Oval curator Lee Fortis. The disagreement arose from restrictions placed on the Indian team's access to the pitch, specifically regarding the distance they were allowed to stand and the curator's objections to their presence.

title: 'Played crucial role in eliminating cowardly terrorists': PM Modi hails Op Mahadev
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the armed forces for Operation Mahadev, which successfully neutralized three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. Union Home Minister Amit Shah informed the Lok Sabha that the operation eliminated Suleman, Afghan, and Jibran, all A-category terrorists.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang sells 202,797 company shares under a pre-arranged ...
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang sold 202,797 shares of Nvidia stock worth approximately $39 million between July 24 and July 28, as revealed in SEC filings. These sales occurred under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan adopted in March, allowing insiders to sell shares without insider trading accusations.

title: TCS layoffs: Amidst mass sackings, firm stops salary hikes & senior level hiring
content: TCS is freezing experienced hiring and global salary hikes amidst concerns over slow demand and AI's impact, potentially cutting 12,000 jobs. This move, impacting cities like Hyderabad and Chennai, sparks industry-wide discussions and worries about a talent "bloodbath."

title: IND vs ENG: The Oval curator shares his version after exchange with Gambhir
content: A heated exchange occurred between India head coach Gautam Gambhir and The Oval curator Lee Fortis regarding practice pitch conditions, prompting intervention from batting coach Sitanshu Kotak. Fortis remained tight-lipped about the specifics of the disagreement. In team news, Arshdeep Singh is set to make his Test debut as India aims to level the series against England in the fifth and final Test.

title: 'Only vidaai is left': Rajasthan MP‚Äôs quirky take on Operation Sindoor and Pakistan ‚Äî watch
content: During a Parliament discussion on Operation Sindoor, Nagaur MP Hanuman Beniwal likened Pakistan to India's "wife," sparking laughter and controversy. His remark followed Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement on the successful operations against terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack, emphasizing Pakistani involvement.

title: Accenture executive says AI can speed up work, but won‚Äôt raise productivity unless‚Ä¶
content: Artificial Intelligence tools can speed up tasks. However, Accenture's Ramine Tinati says it doesn't guarantee productivity. Companies need to redesign workflows for real gains. Some Asian firms are lagging in AI adoption. Tech giants like Amazon and Microsoft are investing heavily in AI. Nvidia's Jensen Huang and OpenAI's Sam Altman believe AI will change jobs.

title: India-US trade deal: As Donald Trump's deadline nears, more talks needed
content: With Trump's tariffs looming, Indian and American officials are in intense discussions to find common ground on customs duties. Despite USTR Jamieson Greer indicating further talks are necessary and a trade deal unlikely soon, officials haven't dismissed a last-minute breakthrough. The next round of talks is scheduled for August 25.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir vs Oval curator: Batting coach reveals 'silly' reason
content: Tensions flared between India's head coach Gautam Gambhir and The Oval's pitch curator Lee Fortis during a training session, sparked by disagreements over pitch access and conduct. The situation escalated, requiring intervention from India's batting coach. This incident follows a series of on-field disagreements throughout the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, highlighting the intense atmosphere surrounding the matches.

title: EXCLUSIVE | IND vs ENG: Arshdeep all set to make his Test debut at Oval
content: Arshdeep Singh is poised to make his Test debut for India in the fifth Test against England, having recovered from a hand injury. The team management had planned to include him in the previous Tests, and his inclusion will likely lead to a rejig of the bowling combination, potentially alongside Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella speaks about 15,000+ employees fired this year
content: Microsoft has announced another round of layoffs, impacting 9,000 employees, bringing the total to over 15,000 this year. CEO Satya Nadella cited the company's shift towards AI as a driving force, despite strong financial performance with $25.8 billion in quarterly net income. The gaming division experienced significant cuts following the Activision Blizzard acquisition.

title: 'Jinki nimbo mirchi laga kar...': Akhilesh takes 'Rafale' jibe at govt in LS
content: Akhilesh Yadav, Samajwadi Party chief, questioned the government about Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha. He claimed India fought a war against China, not Pakistan. Yadav inquired about the number of aircraft used and criticized the handling of the Pulwama attack investigation. He also accused the BJP of politicizing delegation member selections and questioned the current surface area of India.

title: ‚ÄòSaiyaara‚Äô box office: Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda film has a slow start on second Tuesday
content: Saiyaara continues its successful run at the box office, breaking records in its second week. Despite a minor drop on weekdays, the film earned Rs 30 crore on its second Sunday. Second Monday collections were Rs 9.25 crore, and Tuesday afternoon saw Rs 1.6 crore. The total collection now stands at Rs 258.17 crore.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir gets into massive fight with The Oval's ground staff; staff required to step in
content: Tensions flared at The Oval as Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir clashed with the groundstaff over alleged inadequate practice facilities. The heated argument, which involved raised voices and finger-pointing, required intervention from the Indian support staff. India go into the fifth Test trailing England 1-2.

title: 'India expected to miss Rohit, but KL Rahul is playing like a tapasvi'
content: KL Rahul has shone brightly in the Test series against England, effectively filling the void left by Rohit Sharma. He has amassed 511 runs, including two centuries, averaging an impressive 63.88. Aakash Chopra lauded Rahul's disciplined approach and vital contributions with Yashasvi Jaiswal, ensuring India hasn't felt Rohit's absence at the top.

title: EU sanctions hit! Microsoft suspends services at Indian refinery- see details
content: Hit by EU sanctions, the Russia-backed Nayara Energy refinery in India has switched to a local IT company after Microsoft discontinued its services. Nayara, partly owned by Rosneft, is challenging Microsoft's decision in court, arguing the sanctions are affecting its operations and access to crucial data.

title: 'Voter IDs, chocolates ...': Amit Shah lists proof Pahalgam terrorists came from Pak
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced in Lok Sabha that security forces neutralized three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack during Operation Mahadev. The terrorists, identified as Suleman, Afghan, and Jibran, were A-category members of Lashkar-e-Taiba. Investigation involved questioning over a thousand individuals, creating composite sketches, and detaining those who provided food and shelter to the terrorists.

title: 'We have proof': Shah slams Chidambaram's 'homegrown' terrorists remark; asks whom does he want to save?
content: In a Lok Sabha showdown, Amit Shah strongly refuted P Chidambaram's doubts regarding Pakistan's role in the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. Shah presented evidence, including NIA arrests and FSL reports, confirming the terrorists' identities and their Pakistani origin. He accused Chidambaram of giving Pakistan a clean chit and undermining the investigation.

title: Caught on cam: Woman reverses SUV into glass door at Bareilly hotel; panic erupts in lobby
content: In Bareilly, a woman accidentally crashed her SUV through the glass entrance of Hotel Ramada after dinner with her husband. While reversing, she mistakenly accelerated, causing the vehicle to surge backward. The SUV shattered the entrance and rammed into the reception area, creating chaos and property damage, though no injuries were reported.

title: 'Ill-timed': US shuns UN 2-state solution conference; conveys concerns with India
content: The United States has expressed reservations to India regarding the UN 2-state conference, deeming it counterproductive to ending the Gaza conflict and securing hostage releases. Despite US urging, India is participating, seeking constructive engagement towards a 2-state solution. India balances its ties with Israel and its support for the Palestinian cause, advocating for a negotiated resolution.

title: ‚ÄòNegotiations needed‚Ä¶‚Äô: Trump official on India-US trade; no deal before Aug 1?
content: India-US trade deal: Hopes for an imminent India-US trade deal are fading as a top American official indicates that more negotiations are needed before President Trump's August 1 tariff deadline. Despite ongoing discussions, disagreements persist, particularly in agriculture and dairy sectors, where India remains protective.

title: 'If you don't understand my silence ...': Fresh rift within Congress? Manish Tewari post adds to speculation
content: Congress MP Manish Tewari's cryptic social media posts have ignited speculation about internal divisions within the party, particularly regarding national security issues. His silence during a crucial Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor, coupled with Shashi Tharoor's abstention and reported internal criticism, suggests a lack of unified stance within the Congress leadership.

title: NASA-ISRO to launch NISAR on July 30: $1.5B satellite to track climate; GSLV-F16 to make debut
content: The NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar (NISAR) satellite, a joint Earth observation mission, is scheduled to launch on July 30, 2025. This collaboration between India and the US will provide high-resolution, all-weather imagery for disaster management, climate monitoring, and more. NISAR's open-data policy aims to empower global decision-making and emergency response efforts.

title: 'What if Duckett was on 90?: Ex-cricketer slams England over handshake drama
content: Parthiv Patel questions the 'spirit of the game' after England offered a handshake to India during the fourth Test, with Jadeja and Sundar nearing centuries. He wonders if England would have accepted a similar offer if Ben Duckett was close to his century. Patel supports India's decision to continue batting, emphasising their hard-earned position and the right to pursue milestones.

title: 'Absolute filth, embarrassing moment': Stuart Broad on Harry Brook's over where he bowled 37mph
content: Stuart Broad criticized England's tactics during the fourth Test against India, particularly Harry Brook's off-spin bowling, labeling it "embarrassing." Ben Stokes's attempt to speed up the match's conclusion by using Brook and bringing fielders in close drew scrutiny. While opinions diverged, the incident highlights the tension and debate surrounding England's approach as the series heads to a decisive final Test.

title: Jason Kelce jokes about Travis‚Äô Happy Gilmore 2 role in post with their dad
content: Jason Kelce shared a photo with Adam Sandler, his dad, and Travis Kelce. Travis has a cameo in Netflix's Happy Gilmore 2. Jason congratulated Sandler for reviving the classic movie. He also praised Travis for his role as a waiter. The film features a comedic scene. Adam Sandler lauded Kelce's performance. Happy Gilmore 2 is now streaming on Netflix.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Why not declare after Ben Stokes' hundred?' - Sunil Gavaskar slams England's 'loud talk'
content: The drawn Test match between India and England saw heated exchanges. Sunil Gavaskar has now criticized England's tactics. He praised India's resilience, especially Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar's batting. Gavaskar questioned England's delayed declaration. He also referenced past comments from England players about chasing high scores. Gavaskar challenged Shubman Gill to question England's strategy in the post-match conference.

title: TCS layoffs: IT ministry ‚Äòclosely monitoring‚Äô 12k job cuts, claims report
content: India's IT Ministry is closely monitoring TCS's plan to reduce its workforce by over 12,000 employees, primarily impacting middle and senior management. This restructuring, representing two percent of TCS's global staff, is part of a strategy to become a "future-ready organisation.

title: NFL under pressure to review safety measures after New York shooting; 5 killed; league faces calls for urgent action
content: A gunman's deadly rampage at the NFL's New York headquarters triggered a lockdown and claimed a police officer's life, shaking the league's operations. While no players or executives were harmed, the incident prompted immediate security enhancements and internal discussions about the future of the NFL's presence in Midtown Manhattan, including exploring options like remote work and relocation.

title: RBI bets on gold! Central Bank buys half a tonne of gold in June
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) increased its gold reserves by approximately half a tonne in late June, bringing total holdings to 879.8 tonnes. Gold's value within India's foreign exchange reserves has significantly increased, reaching 12.1% as of July 18, 2025.

title: Exited BMW, rifle in hand, began firing in lobby: How Manhattan shooting unfolded
content: A lone gunman, Shane Tamura, unleashed terror in Midtown Manhattan, resulting in five fatalities, including a brave police officer. Tamura, who drove from Las Vegas, initiated the carnage in a Park Avenue building, fatally shooting the officer in the lobby. He then continued his rampage, killing civilians before taking his own life on the 33rd floor.

title: Erin Burnett comes under fire: CNN anchor misidentifies shooter as ‚Äúpossibly white‚Äù; Sparks backlash over premature racial speculation
content: Erin Burnett, a CNN anchor, faces criticism for identifying the Park Avenue shooter as "possibly white" during a live broadcast, contradicting initial NYPD reports describing him as "possibly Middle Eastern." This sparked a social media backlash, raising concerns about racial assumptions and media responsibility in real-time news coverage. The shooter, Shane D. Tamura, killed four before fatally shooting himself.

title: Chinese company banned in America launches rival to Nvidia‚Äôs most-advanced chip
content: Huawei's CloudMatrix 384, showcased at WAIC Shanghai, is emerging as a strong competitor to Nvidia's GB200 NVL72. Despite U.S. restrictions, Huawei is becoming a key Chinese AI chip supplier. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang acknowledged Huawei's progress and warned about the impact of U.S. curbs, suggesting Huawei could dominate if restrictions persist.

title: 'Event management': Congress questions timing of 'Op Mahadev'; asks why not earlier?
content: Congress leader Udit Raj questioned the timing of the Pahalgam attack mastermind's encounter, suggesting it was orchestrated to coincide with the Parliament debate on Operation Sindoor. He speculated the terrorist was already in custody and the army was instructed to delay action for "event management.

title: Jharkhand accident: 5 Kanwariyas dead, 23 hurt in bus-truck collision; CM expresses grief
content: A tragic accident occurred in Deoghar's Mohanpur block. A bus carrying Kanwariyas collided with a truck. The collision resulted in the death of six pilgrims. Twenty-four others sustained serious injuries. The accident took place near Jamuniya forest. Rescue operations are underway. Injured individuals are receiving medical treatment at nearby facilities. Authorities are investigating the incident.

title: Who was Shane Tamura? What we know about the Manhattan building shooter
content: A tragic shooting at a Midtown Manhattan office building on Park Avenue resulted in five fatalities, including an NYPD officer and the suspected gunman, Shane Tamura. Tamura, armed with an AR-15-style rifle, opened fire in the building's lobby before taking his own life.

title: Birth in space: What happens if a baby is born beyond Earth; risks of pregnancy in orbit
content: The possibility of human reproduction in space raises significant biological and technological challenges. Microgravity impacts fetal development and poses logistical difficulties for childbirth, while cosmic radiation threatens DNA and increases the risk of miscarriage and developmental abnormalities. Protecting against radiation and understanding the effects of weightlessness on fetal and infant development are crucial before attempting space pregnancy.

title: Wankhede Stadium heist: IPL jerseys worth Rs 6.5L stolen from BCCI office; security guard held
content: A security guard at the BCCI office in Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly stealing 261 IPL jerseys, valued at Rs 6.52 lakh. Farooque Aslam Khan, the accused, reportedly sold the jerseys to an online dealer to fund his online gambling addiction.

title: Priya Dutt shares pics of brother Sanjay Dutt on his birthday, writes, ‚ÄúWe fight, we laugh, and we cry together..‚Äù
content: Sanjay Dutt celebrated his 66th birthday, receiving warm wishes from family and fans. His sister, Priya Dutt, shared nostalgic photos and a heartfelt message of love and support. Maanayata Dutt posted a touching video montage of their cherished moments, expressing gratitude for his strength, love, and guidance, followed by a cozy family dinner and cake-cutting ceremony.

title: Op Mahadev: Pahalgam attack mastermind among 3 terrorists killed, says report - what we know
content: In Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, security forces neutralized three terrorists in an intense firefight near Dachigam National Park. The operation, dubbed "Operation Mahadev," follows reports linking the terrorists to the April 22 Pahalgam attack, where numerous tourists and a local resident were killed.

title: "Las Vegas of Europe": Foreign Couples Flock To Denmark To Get Married
content: The head of the marriage office at Copenhagen City Hall, Anita Okkels Birk Thomsen, said that about 8,000 wedding ceremonies were performed there last year.

title: Battle Of Baghpat 2.0: Kulhads Fly As Mathura Lassi Sellers Fight On Street
content: The Battle of Baghpat in 2021 was fought over chaat. And the Battle of Mathura in July 2025 has been fought over lassi

title: Explained: How Elon Musk's SpaceX Rocket Diplomacy Backfired In Bahamas
content: The SpaceX rocket landing deal, unlocking a more efficient path to space for SpaceX's reusable Falcon 9, was signed in February last year by Deputy Prime Minister Chester Cooper.

title: Heavy Rain, Floods, Landslides In China Force Evacuations, Kill Over 30 People
content: Heavy rain killed more than 30 people and forced authorities to evacuate tens of thousands as swaths of northern China were lashed by torrential downpours that sparked landslides and flooding, state media said Tuesday.

title: Bengaluru Ex Top Cop Won't Be Reinstated In Same Position: Karnataka Minister
content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara on Tuesday said that the former Bengaluru Police Commissioner B Dayananda, whose suspension has been revoked by the government along with three other police officers, will not be reinstated in the same position.

title: Assam's Kaziranga Now Ranks Third Globally In Tiger Density: Survey
content: Assam's Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve (KNPTR), renowned worldwide as the iconic home of the one-horned rhinoceros, has now added another remarkable feat to its name, a thriving tiger population.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Lunch, Now A State Award: What's With The Growing Pakistan-US Lovefest?
content: After years of being ignored publicly by recent American administrations, the turnaround in established policy is baffling. What gives?

title: "Study My Brain, I'm Sorry..." Manhattan Shooter Leaves Disturbing Suicide Note
content: Shane Devon Tamura, a 27-year-old from Las Vegas, who had been identified as the gunman behind the shooting inside the NFL's headquarters building in New York City on Monday, reportedly left a suicide note.

title: Man Takes Sick Woman To Hospital, Spends 13 Months In Jail After She Dies
content: In a cramped, makeshift room in Bhopal's Adarsh Nagar slum, Rajesh Vishwakarma sits quietly, trying to piece together a life that was unjustly snatched away from him. For 395 days, he lived in jail -- not because he committed a crime, but because he

title: 60,000 Palestinians Killed Since Israel's Military Operation In Gaza
content: Israel's military offensive on the Gaza Strip has killed at least 60,000 Palestinians since Oct. 7, 2023, the enclave's health ministry said, a conflict that has devastated the coastal territory and triggered a humanitarian crisis.

title: Spoofed Calls Reduce By 97% In Government's Anti-Fraud Initiative
content: Union Minister for Communications Jyotiraditya Scindia announced significant achievements in the government's fight against telecom fraud, revealing that the Sanchar Saathi portal has been utilised by 15.5 crore citizens nationwide.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 7 Live Updates: "Take Responsibility": Mallikarjun Kharge To Amit Shah On Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has opened 16-hour long special discussion on the Operation Sindoor in the Rajya Sabha.

title: 'Fix Accountability': M Kharge's Volley Against Centre In Op Sindoor Debate
content: Launching a volley of attacks on the Centre during the debate on Operation Sindoor in the Rajya Sabha, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday said "factories of lies" have been set up and demanded that accountability be fixed.

title: "Appeal In Disguise": Tamil Nadu To Top Court On Presidential Reference On Governor's Powers
content: The Tamil Nadu government has urged the Supreme Court to declare the Presidential Reference on the powers and timelines for Governors and the President to act on state bills as "not maintainable".

title: Face-Off In Lok Sabha As Priyanka Gandhi Reads Out Pahalgam Victim Names
content: The Treasury and Opposition benches faced off in parliament this afternoon as Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra read out the names of the 25 Indians murdered in cold blood by terrorists in Pahalgam.

title: Ethnic Conflict Leaves Manipur's Thriving Agricultural Lands Abandoned
content: Manipur's previously thriving agricultural lands are now hauntingly quiet, reflecting the anxieties and doubts that have engulfed its farming communities since ethnic strife began in May 2023.

title: Turkey Unveils Gazap, 970 Kg "Most Powerful" Non-Nuclear Bomb
content: Turkey has developed two of its most advanced aircraft bombs, showcasing significant improvements in its military strike capabilities.

title: Gangs, Merchants Sell Food Aid In Gaza At Exorbitant Prices Amid Security Breakdown
content: Since Israel's offensive led to a security breakdown in Gaza that has made it nearly impossible to safely deliver food to starving Palestinians, much of the limited aid entering is being hoarded by gangs and merchants and sold at exorbitant prices.

title: Who Is Shailesh Jejurikar, Next CEO Of Procter & Gamble
content: Indian-born executive Shailesh Jejurikar will take over as the Chief Executive Officer of American Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) giant, Procter & Gamble, effective January 1, 2026.

title: NYC shooter was targeting NFL HQ, mayor says
content: A gunman who killed four people at a Manhattan office building was trying to target the headquarters of the NFL but took the wrong elevator.

title: Cubs Hall of Famer Sandberg dies at age 65
content: Ryne Sandberg, a Hall of Fame second baseman who spent nearly all of his playing career with the Cubs, died Monday after a recurrence of cancer.

title: 'It was a no-brainer': Paul celebrated in L.A. return
content: Eight years after he last played for the franchise, Chris Paul was reintroduced as a member of the Clippers on Monday, calling his return to Los Angeles a "no-brainer."

title: D-backs 3B Su√°rez hit on hand, X-rays negative
content: D-backs All-Star Eugenio Su√°rez hopes he avoided a major injury when he was hit on the right index finger by a pitch on Monday.

title: Deion says he's cancer-free after bladder removal
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

title: Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Raiders player offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Dallas' Guyton (knee) out, but ACL intact
content: An MRI revealed that Cowboys left tackle Tyler Guyton suffered a bone fracture -- not a torn ACL -- in his right knee during Monday's practice. He will sit out four to six weeks, but the injury will not require surgery.

title: Sparks' Brink to return from torn ACL vs. Aces
content: Cameron Brink, the No. 2 pick in the 2024 WNBA draft, is set to make her season debut for the Sparks on Tuesday night against the Aces, 13 months after tearing her left ACL.

content: Haliburton staged the proposal inside Hilton Coliseum on the Iowa State campus, where the couple began dating.

content: Grand Canyon moved up its timeline to switch from the WAC to the Mountain West, which significantly shifts the bracket dynamics.

content: The quarterback enters Year 10 with the Cowboys, and he is focused on health, family and winning a Super Bowl.

title: Cincy on the up after tight draw vs. Messi-less Miami
content: Cincinnati is looking like one of the league's best again after taking the fight to Miami, climbing the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

content: Liverpool's pursuit of Alexander Isak amid a summer of big spending isn't about being better this season but about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal?
content: the 2025 draft has wrapped up, with the rookie class debuting at summer leagues and teams looking ahead to next season . we polled 20 anonymous executives and scouts, asking for their thoughts on the draft and what teams are expecting from their new faces .

title: Brock Purdy and wife, Jenna, announce birth of first child
content: Purdy's wife, Jenna, gave birth to the couple's first child, millie Joleen . the 49ers' new arrival came nearly two weeks after star running back Christian McCaffrey and his wife had their first child .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Gonzalez goes down for Pats
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . follow the links below to learn everything we are seeing and hearing at camp .

title: 'It's about standards and details': Man United, Amorim aiming to start anew
content: Ruben Amorim arrived in the us for man united's preseason tour with a smile back on his face . he snapped back at reporters who suggested the performance had been poor . but time back in Portugal has allowed for a reset and at the start of a pivotal summer for the club .

title: We ranked every NFL team by under-25 talent: Which teams have the best -- and worst -- young cores?
content: for the third straight year, the Houston Texans are no. 1 on this list of teams with the most under-25 talent . a year ago, the texans were way ahead of everyone else when it came to ranking talent under 25 years old .

title: Don't stop believing: The inside story of how England won Euro 2025
content: the Lionesses were draped in gold-and-silver ticker tape as basel danced to the echo of 2022 and the new heroines of 2025 . they were the first team to win two major tournaments, and the first on foreign soil . as the celebrations began after the penalty shootout win over Spain , Lucy Bronze was hopping on one leg .

title: Vehicular movement banned from Hondarabalu check-post to K. Gudi till September 27
content: Ban ordered in view of the development works taken up on selected sections of Nanjangud-Biligiri Rangana Betta or B.R. Hills road

title: NISAR mission would showcase Indian space engineering on a global scale: Ex-ISRO scientist
content: ‚ÄúNISAR is one of the key missions that will garner large-scale operational user feedback from across the globe,‚Äù Ex-Project Manager of NISAR said

title: Centre pegs 9.4% growth in FY26 cess, surcharge collections at ‚Çπ5.91 lakh crore
content: This is higher than FY25 cess and surcharge collection of ‚Çπ3.87 lakh crore and ‚Çπ1.53 lakh crore, respectively

title: China has not intruded even an inch into Indian territory since 1962: Rijiju in Lok Sabha
content: ‚ÄúIt is important to correct the record. Since 1962, China has not intruded even an inch into our territory nor occupied any additional land. This fact must be made clear,‚Äù Mr. Rijiju said

title: Defence Ministry signs MoU with TIDCO to set up testing facility in Defence Corridor in Tiruchi
content: Set up under the Defence Testing Infrastructure Scheme (DTIS), up to 75% funding is provided as ‚Äògrant-in-aid‚Äô with 25% funds raised by the Special Purpose Vehicle

title: Synod of Orthodox Church expresses anguish over persecution of Christians
content: The synod condemns the attack on the two Keralite nuns by religious extremists and their subsequent arrest on charges of human trafficking and forced religious conversion

title: Operation Sindoor discussion: Nadda apologises to Kharge, takes back his words
content: J.P. Nadda accused Mallikarjun Kharge of "losing his mental balance" as he made some remarks against Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Farmers‚Äô organisation moots scheme to pump surplus Cauvery water to tanks in Karur district
content: Cauvery Padugai Farmers Federation says  government should implement a project to link 14 tanks in Kulithalai, Thogamalai, and Krishnarayapuram blocks of Karur district and divert surplus Cauvery water into them

title: Bengaluru‚Äôs tree census turns a new leaf as BBMP eyes December deadline
content: This August will mark six years since the Karnataka High Court directed the BBMP to carry out a tree census across the city, initially giving it a three-year deadline.  The BBMP has managed to complete just over 30% of the work.

title: Operation Sindoor symbol of government‚Äôs failure: Akhilesh Yadav in Lok Sabha
content: Akhilesh Yadav raised questions on India ending the conflict with Pakistan abruptly and asked, ‚ÄúUnder whose pressure was the ceasefire done?‚Äù

title: AIIMS Bhubaneswar nursing officer held for 'sexual harassment' of woman attendant
content: Immediately after the registration of the FIR, all the employees, including the woman attendant started a demonstration outside the main gate of the hospital

title: Opposition leaders protest against SIR in Parliament complex
content: Ahead of the day's proceedings in Parliament, several MPs of the Opposition, including those of the Congress, DMK, TMC, RJD and Left parties, among others, participated in the protest on the steps of the Makar Dwar of Parliament and raised slogans.

title: Visakhapatnam to emerge as Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs growth engine: CM Chandrababu
content: In a key interaction, the Chief Minister met¬†Lim Yeang Yeow, Executive Director of Keppel Corporation, a Singapore-based conglomerate known for its expertise in urban development, infrastructure, and commercial real estate.¬†

title: ED filed closure reports in 49 PMLA cases over last 10 years: Government
content: ED secured eight conviction orders involving 15 people from the special Prevention of Money Laundering Act courts between 2015 to June 2025, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said in a written statement in the Rajya Sabha

title: SPMVV signs MoU with Singapore firm to foster innovation
content: The tie-up would help establish a startup accelerator, launch of a skilling academy in startup entrepreneurship and awards to recognise best women innovators at the PhD/post-doc level

title: Call to prioritise skill training for AI era
content: JNU Professor Ubaidur Rahman emphasizes practical skill training for students at Madeenathul Uloom Arabic College induction programme.

title: Illegal fences by tea estates primary cause of rising human-elephant conflict in Gudalur: Forest department
content: The Forest department now believes that 11 migratory paths that had been used by elephants to move through the region have become blocked by illegal settlements, fences, plantations, encroachments, and other bottlenecks

title: From paper to portal: Goa rolls out digital push for village panchayat services
content: From next month onwards, proceedings of the panchayat meetings and certified copies of resolutions adopted by the panchayats would be available online

title: Chinnakanal land deals: ED probe on against Kerala‚Äôs Congress MLA Mathew Kuzhalnadan
content: ED is expected to question Kuzhalnandan, who has said he will cooperate with any inquiry into the allegations

title: ‚Çπ1650 crore drinking water project grounded in Eastern, Central Godavari delta
content: Executed by the MEIL group, a 350-km-long pipeline will be laid to ensure access to safe drinking water for 66,000 households under the Jal Jeevan Mission

title: Karnataka rain: Vehicular traffic to Himavad Gopalaswamy Hills in Chamarajanagar district banned for two days to enable repair of road damaged by landslides
content: The road leading to the Himavad Gopalaswamy Hills was damaged in a landslide on July 17 following heavy rains in the area

title: ISRO Chairman prays at Chengalamma temple
content: It has been a practice for the ISRO authorities to visit this temple ahead of satellite launches and pray for the success of the ensuing missions

title: U.S. team to visit India on August 25 for next round of talks for trade pact
content: According to officials, the two sides continue to be engaged in an interim trade deal as the August 1 deadline is approaching.

title: Maharashtra government issues guidelines for government servants
content: The new guidelines issued by the Maharashtra govt. includes a directive to govt. servants not to criticise govt policies, warn of disciplinary action

title: Bihar Cabinet approves constitution of commission for upliftment of sanitation workers
content: A meeting of the Bihar Cabinet, chaired by Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, approved a proposal of the Urban Development and Housing Department in this regard

title: 'Japan training kids to rule AI world, we're not even making AI workers': AAP slams Centre
content: Most of the government schools across the country are in ruins. Only 4.8% schools have computer labs. Only 29% students in fifth standard can do maths of second class, says AAP leader Manish Sisodia

title: Flood-like situation in parts of Rajasthan after heavy rain
content: Rivers in several districts, including Kota, Bundi, Jhalawar, Dholpur and Tonk, are overflowing following heavy downpour

title: Moolampilly rehabilitation package: Measures to be adopted to stabilise sites
content: Possibility of utilising soil dredged by Cochin Port Authority for filling up rehabilitation site at Indira Nagar in Thuthiyoor may be explored

title: Three convicted in ganja case, sentenced to jail by Guntur Court
content: The case pertains to a raid conducted in 2014 on a house in Karlapalem village of Bapatla district, according to District Superintendent of Police

title: Talked of Nehru, my mother's tears but did not answer why war was stopped: Priyanka Gandhi slams govt
content: It is a big failure of our government and intelligence agencies. Who will take responsibility of this? Has anyone resigned? questions Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

title: Supreme Court stays trial in two cases involving Azam Khan's son Abdullah
content: The Supreme Court Bench also issued notice to the Uttar Pradesh Government on an appeal filed by Abdullah Azam Khan

title: Kaziranga records third-highest tiger density in India
content: The 2024 report on the status of tigers says Kaziranga Tiger Reserve has a density of 18.65 tigers per 100 square kilometre

title: Prepare action plan to make Greater Hyderabad pollution free; study major cities before finalising it: Telangana CM Revanth
content: Mr. Revanth Reddy directs officials to follow his directions to replace overhead power lines with underground cables throughout the Greater Hyderabad limits

title: Over 80,000 students given tentative allotment in round 2 of T.N. engineering admission counselling
content: The candidates are required to confirm their seats using proper confirmation option on or before July 30

title: Bengali-speaking migrant family in Delhi threatened, claims Mamata
content: Mamata Banerjee had shared a video on social media, alleging that a Bengali-speaking woman and her child were assaulted in the national capital for speaking their language

title: Supreme Court fixes Presidential Reference hearing from August 19, to first hear T.N. and Kerala on maintainability
content: A Constitution Bench headed by Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai said the hearing on the Reference would kick off on August 19 with the two States getting an hour to convince the Court to return the Reference unanswered

title: Suvendu alleges Mamata attempting to 'intimidate' poll officers, writes to EC seeking action
content: Suvendu Adhikari alleged that Banerjee made public statements that constitute a "direct and unwarranted interference" in the duties of BLOS and the broader electoral framework overseen by the ECI.

title: Manipur preparing for Special Intensive Revision, says Joint CEO
content: BLO training, meetings with political parties underway; Joint CEO adds no specific timelines have been communicated for SIR in Manipur

title: Actor Raveendran withdraws his nomination for AMMA president post
content: However, he will contest for the post of general secretary in the election for the executive committee of the association to be held on August 15

title: Around 74% of 1,087 monitored wells in Karnataka registered rise in groundwater level: Jal Shakti Ministry
content: Over 16.66 lakh water conservation and artificial recharge structures were constructed or renovated in Karnataka since 2021 under various initiatives of the Central and State governments

title: BJP in Kerala defends ‚Äòmistaken‚Äô arrests of nuns in Chhattisgarh, distances itself from Bajrang Dal
content: Rajeev Chandrasekhar says the two nuns were ‚Äònot human traffickers or proselytisers‚Äô as accused by Bajrang Dal activists in Chhattisgarh and that Bajrang Dal does not bear BJP‚Äôs imprimatur and is an independent organisation

title: NIA launches probe into killing of Pahalgam attack mastermind in Srinagar encounter
content: The Army's elite para commandos on July 28 claimed to have gunned down Sulieman alias Asif, the alleged mastermind of the April 22 attack

title: Dharmasthala burials: Process of exhuming bodies begins
content: On July 28, the complainant showed 13 spots where bodies have allegedly been buried, around the bathing ghat in Dharmasthala, to the SIT personnel

title: Panneerselvam shifts stance, condemns BJP over Samagra Shiksha funds controversy
content: Ever since Mr. Panneerselvam rebelled against the AIADMK‚Äôs former interim general secretary V.K. Sasikala in February 2017, he had been known as a staunch ally of the BJP

title: Delegations of LDF, UDF head to Chhattisgarh to champion cause of arrested Keralite nuns
content: Controversial arrests, which prompted bipartisan protests in Kerala, occurred after Bajrang Dal workers mobbed the two nuns at a railway station, accusing them of spiriting away three women, including a tribal community member, to Agra for conversion

title: Private school correspondent arrested for impregnating Class X student in Konaseema
content: The accused has allegedly raped the victim about five months ago; The incident came to light during a medical health check-up.

title: Rahul Gandhi to sponsor education of 22 children who lost parents in Pakistan shelling during Operation Sindoor
content: Poonch district alone accounted for 13 civilian deaths among 28 fatalities in the Pakistani shelling and drone attacks in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Golden disc and conch donated to Tirumala temple
content: The value of the precious donation which weighed 2.5 kilograms is approximately pegged around ‚Çπ2.40 crore.

title: Deleted, not denied: The truth behind Kanthapuram‚Äôs claim on Nimisha Priya‚Äôs reprieve
content: When ANI deleted an original tweet on Nimisha Priya‚Äôs reprieve, it automatically disappeared from Kanthapuram Aboobacker Musliar‚Äôs X handle, leading to confusions and speculations about the Malayali nurse‚Äôs fate in Yemen

title: Gogoi's Parliament speech proves he acts on behalf of Pakistan: Himanta
content: His (Gaurav Gogoi) secret trip and close ties with the Pakistani establishment speak volumes, says Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Expedite investigation, trial in 37 cases pending against ‚ÄòSavukku‚Äô Shankar: Madras High Court
content: Justice P. Velmurugan orders completion of investigation within four months in 13 cases and completion of trial within six months in 24 other cases

title: Three terrorists who carried out Pahalgam terror attack killed: Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah said that the three terrorists have been identified as Suleiman, Jibran and Afghan Bhai, all Pakistani nationals, and they were tracked with the help of human and technical intelligence in an operation led by the Intelligence Bureau, Army, Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) and J&K police.

title: Maratha reservation: Jarange warns of fresh hunger strike on August 29

title: Google urged to set up a Chip Designing Centre in Visakhapatnam

title: National Herald case: Court defers order on cognisance of ED charge sheet

title: Lokesh invites ST Telemedia to establish Green Energy Data Centre in Visakhapatnam
content: During the meeting, Mr. Lokesh urged the company to establish a Green Energy-Powered Data Center in Visakhapatnam, which is being developed as a dedicated Data City in Andhra Pradesh.

title: Idol vandalised in Uttar Pradesh‚Äôs Sonbhadra temple; police register FIR

title: Pregnant women taken on bullock cart, cot through slushy roads after heavy rains in Madhya Pradesh

title: Faced online abuse for years, but rape threats are a new low: Actor Ramya
